code:
export const remnants = [{
  id: 1,
  title: "Remnant: Gyoubu",
  location: "Ashina Castle Gate",
  type: "Memory",
  description: "The battle memory of an extraordinary foe. Although distant, recollection of such a memory provided sustenance for the Wolf. Gyoubu Oniwa once led a group of infamous bandits, but was defeated by Isshin, who was so captivated by his show of strength that he took him in as an Ashina warrior. Oniwa would later go on to become Genichiro Ashina's most trusted retainer.",
  img: "remnant-gyoubu-oniwa.png"
}, {
  id: 2,
  title: "Remnant: Lady Butterfly",
  type: "Memory",
  location: "Bamboo Thicket Slope",
  description: "The battle memory of an extraordinary foe. Although distant, recollection of such a memory provided sustenance for the Wolf. The Phantom Lady Butterfly was appointed by the Wolf's foster father as one of his mentors in the shinobi techniques. These mentors employed strict methods. The cultivation of shinobi techniques can only be achieved in the midst of battle.",
  img: "remnant-lady-butterfly.png"
}, {
  id: 3,
  title: "Remnant: Genichiro",
  location: "Ashina Castle",
  type: "Memory",
  description: "The battle memory of an extraordinary foe. Although distant, recollection of such a memory provided sustenance for the Wolf. Born a peasant, Genichiro Ashina was taken in by the Ashina after his mother's death. With his country on the brink of defeat, Genichiro took to the heretical arts and master the Lightning of Tomoe. Such heresy may be the key to saving her.",
  img: "remnant-genichiro.png"
}, {
  id: 4,
  title: "Remnant: Screen Monkeys",
  location: "Shugendo",
  type: "Memory",
  description: "The battle memory of an extraordinary foe. Although distant, recollection of such a memory provided sustenance for the Wolf. The Halls of Illusion lie on the threshold betwixt life and death. Departed souls of the Divine Children drift and savvy, taking shelter in the monkeys of the temple. Such is why the Divine Child of Rejuvenation speaks of them as friends.",
  img: "remnant-screen-monkeys.png"
}, {
  id: 5,
  title: "Remnant: Guardian Ape",
  location: "Sunken Valley",
  type: "Memory",
  description: "The battle memory of an extraordinary foe. Although distant, recollection of such a memory provided sustenance for the Wolf. They say that an infested body is the mark of the undying, but such a long life would surely be quite lonesome for even an ape. Perhaps the echoing roar of the Guardian Ape was in fact a solicitation of sorts.",
  img: "remnant-guardian-ape.webp"
}, {
  id: 6,
  title: "Remnant: Corrupted Monk",
  location: "Wedding Cave Door ",
  type: "Memory",
  description: "The battle memory of an extraordinary foe. Although distant, recollection of such a memory provided sustenance for the Wolf. The Corrupt Monk donned the mask of a fierce guardian deity. Her form was nebulous, appearing as if in a dream. What reason could there have been for guarding the Mibu Village cave entrance.",
  img: "remnant-corrupted-monk.webp"
}, {
  id: 7,
  title: "Remnant: Headless Ape",
  location: "Sunken Valley",
  type: "Memory",
  description: "The battle memory of an extraordinary foe. Although distant, recollection of such a memory provided sustenance for the Wolf. At one time the Guardian Ape shared its den with a mate. Be he alone became infested, while others passed away. Now, even the flowers offered in tribute to her passing have withered to dust.",
  img: "remnant-headless-ape.webp"
}, {
  id: 8,
  title: "Remnant: Great Shinobi",
  location: "Upper Tower - Antechamber",
  type: "Memory",
  description: "The battle memory of an extraordinary foe. Although distant, recollection of such a memory provided sustenance for the Wolf. The Great Shinobi Owl's unbridled ambition was to obtain the power of the Dragon's Heritage. Now is the time to let one's true name ring out across all of Japan. It was all for the sake of ambition.",
  img: "remnant-great-shinobi.png"
}, {
  id: 9,
  title: "Remnant: Isshin Ashina",
  location: "Upper Tower - Antechamber",
  type: "Memory",
  description: "The battle memory of an extraordinary foe. Although distant, recollection of such a memory provided sustenance for the Wolf. Isshin Ashina was a true master of the sword; no less so in his vale of years.",
  img: "remnant-isshin-ashina.png"
}, {
  id: 10,
  title: "Remnant: True Monk",
  location: "Sanctuary",
  type: "Memory",
  description: "The battle memory of an extraordinary foe. Although distant, recollection of such a memory provided sustenance for the Wolf. The Corrupted Monk was among the infested, standing over the Fountainhead Palace. Indeed, immortality would seem fitting quality for eternal watcher of the palace. Her true name was Priestess Yao.",
  img: "remnant_true-monk.png"
}, {
  id: 11,
  title: "Remnant: Divine Dragon",
  location: "Sanctuary",
  type: "Memory",
  description: "The battle memory of an extraordinary foe. Although distant, recollection of such a memory provided sustenance for the Wolf. The Divine Dragon of the Everblossom came from the west long ago, eventually making its way to this land. Some parts of Ashina are exceedingly old. Water coursing through her ancient rocks and soil allowed the Dragon to take root.",
  img: "remnant_divine_dragon.png"
}, {
  id: 12,
  title: "Remnant: Foster Father",
  location: "Hirata Estate - Main Hall",
  type: "Memory",
  description: "Owl took in the hungry cub on a whim and raised him as a shinobi. The process was so engrossing that he hoped they might enjoy a true battle to the death some day. He got his wish, if only in an old memory.",
  img: "remnant-foster-father.png"
}, {
  id: 13,
  title: "Remnant: Hatred Demon",
  location: "Ashina Castle Gate",
  type: "Memory",
  description: "A man who failed to become Shura instead become a vessel for the flames of hatred. As fate would have it, he was bound stubbornly to this world. It wasn't until he became a demon that he was finally able to depart for the next.",
  img: "remnant-hatred-demon.png"
}, {
  id: 14,
  title: "Remnant: Saint Isshin",
  location: "Ashina Castle",
  type: "Memory",
  description: "The battle memory of an extraordinary foe. Although distant, recollection of such a memory provided sustenance for the Wolf. One who returns from the great beyond does so at the peak of their prosperity. Isshin coveted strength and all manner of techniques throughout his mortal struggle. He wished for war until his final hour, and that is precisely what he got.",
  img: "remnant-saint-isshin.png"
}];

sourcesContent:
export const remnants = [
  {
    id: 1,
    title: `Remnant: Gyoubu`,
    location: `Ashina Castle Gate`,
    type: `Memory`,
    description: `The battle memory of an extraordinary foe. Although distant, recollection of such a memory provided sustenance for the Wolf. Gyoubu Oniwa once led a group of infamous bandits, but was defeated by Isshin, who was so captivated by his show of strength that he took him in as an Ashina warrior. Oniwa would later go on to become Genichiro Ashina's most trusted retainer.`,
    img: `remnant-gyoubu-oniwa.png`
  },
  {
    id: 2,
    title: `Remnant: Lady Butterfly`,
    type: `Memory`,
    location: `Bamboo Thicket Slope`,
    description: `The battle memory of an extraordinary foe. Although distant, recollection of such a memory provided sustenance for the Wolf. The Phantom Lady Butterfly was appointed by the Wolf's foster father as one of his mentors in the shinobi techniques. These mentors employed strict methods. The cultivation of shinobi techniques can only be achieved in the midst of battle.`,
    img: `remnant-lady-butterfly.png`
  },
  {
    id: 3,
    title: `Remnant: Genichiro`,
    location: `Ashina Castle`,
    type: `Memory`,
    description: `The battle memory of an extraordinary foe. Although distant, recollection of such a memory provided sustenance for the Wolf. Born a peasant, Genichiro Ashina was taken in by the Ashina after his mother's death. With his country on the brink of defeat, Genichiro took to the heretical arts and master the Lightning of Tomoe. Such heresy may be the key to saving her.`,
    img: `remnant-genichiro.png`
  },
  {
    id: 4,
    title: `Remnant: Screen Monkeys`,
    location: `Shugendo`,
    type: `Memory`,
    description: `The battle memory of an extraordinary foe. Although distant, recollection of such a memory provided sustenance for the Wolf. The Halls of Illusion lie on the threshold betwixt life and death. Departed souls of the Divine Children drift and savvy, taking shelter in the monkeys of the temple. Such is why the Divine Child of Rejuvenation speaks of them as friends.`,
    img: `remnant-screen-monkeys.png`
  },
  {
    id: 5,
    title: `Remnant: Guardian Ape`,
    location: `Sunken Valley`,
    type: `Memory`,
    description: `The battle memory of an extraordinary foe. Although distant, recollection of such a memory provided sustenance for the Wolf. They say that an infested body is the mark of the undying, but such a long life would surely be quite lonesome for even an ape. Perhaps the echoing roar of the Guardian Ape was in fact a solicitation of sorts.`,
    img: `remnant-guardian-ape.webp`
  },
  {
    id: 6,
    title: `Remnant: Corrupted Monk`,
    location: `Wedding Cave Door `,
    type: `Memory`,
    description: `The battle memory of an extraordinary foe. Although distant, recollection of such a memory provided sustenance for the Wolf. The Corrupt Monk donned the mask of a fierce guardian deity. Her form was nebulous, appearing as if in a dream. What reason could there have been for guarding the Mibu Village cave entrance.`,
    img: `remnant-corrupted-monk.webp`
  },
  {
    id:7,
    title: `Remnant: Headless Ape`,
    location: `Sunken Valley`,
    type: `Memory`,
    description: `The battle memory of an extraordinary foe. Although distant, recollection of such a memory provided sustenance for the Wolf. At one time the Guardian Ape shared its den with a mate. Be he alone became infested, while others passed away. Now, even the flowers offered in tribute to her passing have withered to dust.`,
    img: `remnant-headless-ape.webp`
  },
  {
    id: 8,
    title: `Remnant: Great Shinobi`,
    location: `Upper Tower - Antechamber`,
    type: `Memory`,
    description: `The battle memory of an extraordinary foe. Although distant, recollection of such a memory provided sustenance for the Wolf. The Great Shinobi Owl's unbridled ambition was to obtain the power of the Dragon's Heritage. Now is the time to let one's true name ring out across all of Japan. It was all for the sake of ambition.`,
    img: `remnant-great-shinobi.png`
  },
  {
    id: 9,
    title: `Remnant: Isshin Ashina`,
    location: `Upper Tower - Antechamber`,
    type: `Memory`,
    description: `The battle memory of an extraordinary foe. Although distant, recollection of such a memory provided sustenance for the Wolf. Isshin Ashina was a true master of the sword; no less so in his vale of years.`,
    img: `remnant-isshin-ashina.png`
  },
  {
    id: 10,
    title: `Remnant: True Monk`,
    location: `Sanctuary`,
    type: `Memory`,
    description: `The battle memory of an extraordinary foe. Although distant, recollection of such a memory provided sustenance for the Wolf. The Corrupted Monk was among the infested, standing over the Fountainhead Palace. Indeed, immortality would seem fitting quality for eternal watcher of the palace. Her true name was Priestess Yao.`,
    img: `remnant_true-monk.png`
  },
  {
    id: 11,
    title: `Remnant: Divine Dragon`,
    location: `Sanctuary`,
    type: `Memory`,
    description: `The battle memory of an extraordinary foe. Although distant, recollection of such a memory provided sustenance for the Wolf. The Divine Dragon of the Everblossom came from the west long ago, eventually making its way to this land. Some parts of Ashina are exceedingly old. Water coursing through her ancient rocks and soil allowed the Dragon to take root.`,
    img: `remnant_divine_dragon.png`
  },
  {
    id: 12,
    title: `Remnant: Foster Father`,
    location: `Hirata Estate - Main Hall`,
    type: `Memory`,
    description: `Owl took in the hungry cub on a whim and raised him as a shinobi. The process was so engrossing that he hoped they might enjoy a true battle to the death some day. He got his wish, if only in an old memory.`,
    img: `remnant-foster-father.png`
  },
  {
    id: 13,
    title: `Remnant: Hatred Demon`,
    location: `Ashina Castle Gate`,
    type: `Memory`,
    description: `A man who failed to become Shura instead become a vessel for the flames of hatred. As fate would have it, he was bound stubbornly to this world. It wasn't until he became a demon that he was finally able to depart for the next.`,
    img: `remnant-hatred-demon.png`
  },
  {
    id: 14,
    title: `Remnant: Saint Isshin`,
    location: `Ashina Castle`,
    type: `Memory`,
    description: `The battle memory of an extraordinary foe. Although distant, recollection of such a memory provided sustenance for the Wolf. One who returns from the great beyond does so at the peak of their prosperity. Isshin coveted strength and all manner of techniques throughout his mortal struggle. He wished for war until his final hour, and that is precisely what he got.`,
    img: `remnant-saint-isshin.png`
  }
]
